title: Connecting Rod - Installation

body.body: Connecting rod bolts MUST only be used once. If the bolts are removed or undone for any reason, new bolts MUST always be used. Reusing bolts can cause connecting rods and their caps to detach from the crankshaft causing severe engine damage, loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If the connecting rod bolts are removed, the connecting rod, big end cap, bearings and connecting rod bolts must be replaced. Using the original components may lead to severe engine damage.
Always check the bearing journal clearance (see
Connecting Rod Big End Journal Checking, Measuring and Bearing Selection
Crankshaft Main Bearing/Journal Checking, Measuring and Bearing Selection
), before final assembly of the crankshaft. Failure to correctly select bearing journal shells will result in severe engine damage.
Check, measure and, if necessary, select new connecting rod big end bearing shells (see
Connecting Rod Big End Journal Checking, Measuring and Bearing Selection
Check, measure and, if necessary, select new crankshaft main bearing shells (see
Crankshaft Main Bearing/Journal Checking, Measuring and Bearing Selection
Failure to use new gudgeon pin circlips could allow the pin to detach from the piston. This could seize the engine resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit a new circlip to the inside of the piston. Make sure the circlip is correctly located in the piston groove.
Lubricate the connecting rod small-end and gudgeon pin with clean engine oil.
Align the piston with the connecting rod, make sure the triangular mark on the piston crown is facing towards the front of the engine.
Insert the gudgeon pin into the piston and push it fully into position.
Secure the gudgeon pin in position with the remaining new circlip. Make sure the circlip is correctly located in the piston groove.

Fit the three piston and connecting rod assemblies into the barrel from the bottom as noted for removal. Make sure that the piston alignment mark on the piston faces the same direction as noted for removal.
